item.title: Overhanging vegetation, including brambles, come down to shoulder height on the pavement and almost reach the road., 3rd September
item.description:

item.title: Major potholes causing serioua vibration at the entire building, 3rd September
item.description:
There are deep potholes stretching over 400–500 meters of the bus lane for over 4-5 months. Every time a large vehicle passes, the all twenty flats at Tait House shake severely, causing damage to the building’s structure and increasing risks to both safety and property. This situation also puts drivers and passengers at risk. It is urgent that this issue is addressed without delay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Junction Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is about 2 or 3 pot holes on the road , next to the greenery, 3rd September
item.description:
This pot hole has been forming for quite a long while maybe a month and is getting worse There is a massive pot hole on the road, there is 2 or 3 of them and it's causing damage to cars that are parked due to lose debris and stones flying all over the road., please can this be looked into with a matter of urgency as it is getting bigger

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deansway, Edmonton, London

item.title: Overgrown ivy, 3rd September
item.description:
I reported this already and nothing was done. This ivy is pushing my fence. There are damage already to the bricks and ivy growing inside through the brick wall. Plus, growing over the fence into my garden. The side of my house is a rubbish dump because of this vegetation. My ref for this is 7975734 and I’m waiting for contact for almost one month now. I cut a lot of it that was invading my house, but if nothing is done, I will cut everything on the pavement and leave the vegetation there in the street. Also, now my brick wall needs fixing. Please get in touch as soon as possible to resolve this issue. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 3rd September
item.description:
Fly tipped waste from the property doing building work next door. Already reported to Greenwich a council who marked as fixed. Clearly this is not the case and shows corruption or negligence from the council or it's providers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorntree Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet
